internationalizations.title: Life Simulation Monopoly – When AI Becomes the Game Master
internationalizations.description: A weekend idea turned into a full-fledged AI-driven life simulation, where an LLM writes and directs your journey in real time. Roll the dice, make your choices, and see what unpredictable (and sometimes hilarious) fate the Game Master AI has in store for you.

internationalizations.title: Building a Community Forum from Scratch
internationalizations.description: No Worries, Neighbour is a community forum designed to strengthen local connections through technology. Members can exchange second-hand goods, organize local events, and join Q&A discussions. Built as a full-stack application and deployed on cloud infrastructure, the project showcased our skills in web development, cloud deployment, and incentive system design.

internationalizations.title: Cynthia develops chatbot to boost malaria research efforts
internationalizations.description:
Cynthia Chen, a UWA Master of Information Technology student, developed an AI chatbot during her internship at The Kids Research Institute Australia to support malaria research. The tool uses natural language processing to help researchers quickly find definitions, navigate complex documentation, and validate XML inputs for the OpenMalaria simulation software.

By applying software design principles and systematic problem-solving, Cynthia delivered a fully working prototype—exceeding expectations and earning praise from the research team for its immediate value to the global malaria research community.

internationalizations.title: Kaggle Titanic survival prediction project
internationalizations.description: A hands-on Kaggle Titanic survival prediction project applying Ensemble Learning with Soft Voting. Combined predictions from multiple classifiers to enhance accuracy and robustness of the model.
